quiz.text: International Criminal Court (ICC) is an international tribunal seated in the Hague, Netherlands. It is the first and only permanent international court with jurisdiction to prosecute individuals for the international crimes of genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes and the crime of aggression. ­­­­­_______ marks anniversary of the founding treaty of the International Criminal Court (ICC). ________ is celebrated every year to commemorate the efforts and the role played by ICC in serving justice.
options: July 15, Criminal Court Day
July 15, Global Justice Day
July 17, World Day for International Justice
July 15, World Day for International Justice
July 17, International Court of Justice Day

quiz.text: Snakes work as natural pest control in the environment. A lot of myths and misconceptions associated with snakes contribute to its shrinking population. Snakes have more than 3,500 species with just around 600 of them actually venomous. World Snake Day is observed on _____ to raise awareness on the conservation of these creatures.
options: July 17
July 16
July 18
July 15
July 12

quiz.text: Spanning a vast 35 acres and assembled over four years, this new building comprises nine interconnected buildings, linked by a central spine, covering an expansive 7.1 million square feet of floor space. Valued at 3,200 crore ($388 million), this grand edifice exemplifies the fusion of aesthetics and functionality. It is designed by Indian architecture firm Morphogenesis, based in New Delhi. The _______ surpassed the ________ to become the largest office structure in the world.
options: Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT) office, Petronas Tower
The Baya Park, Pentagon
Surat Diamond Bourse, Pentagon
Central Vista Project, Petronas Tower
Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT) office, Le Centre Pompidou

quiz.text: ________authored by the former Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) of India, who made a significant difference to Indian elections. It was published by Rupa Publications India. This autobiography covers term of ______ as the CEC from 1990 to 1995. It has been published 4 years after he passed away in 2019.
options: Bureaucrazy Gets Crazier: IAS Unmasked – TN Seshan

An Undocumented Wonder – the Making of the Great Indian Election, S.Y. Quraishi
The Honest Always Stand Alone: An Autobiography, C. G. Somiah

quiz.text: In recent years, Pokhran — now a small town — has caught people’s imagination via popular culture, the latest being the second part of the web series ‘Rocket Boys’. Some of the scientists featured in dramatized versions of the 1974 and 1998 nuclear tests are surviving to share behind-the-scene stories of the two iconic events in India’s science and technology journey. Experimental physicist R Chidambaram is one such. He has the unique distinction of having played a vital role in both Pokhran-1 and Pokhran-2. So, it is natural for him to focus on nuclear tests in his autobiography, _______.
options: We the Rocket Boys
My Atomic Dream
India Rising: Memoir of a Scientist
My Days in the middle of Desert
None of the Above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) Punjab National Bank (PNB) has launched an eight-month period environmental initiative called _________ to embrace sustainability. This initiative includes digi branches, green data centers, electrical vehicle finance, recycling camps, tree plantation drive, Paper Conservation Drive, Energy Conservation Olympiads etc.
options: PNB Indradhanush
Project PNB PALAASH
Project Green Banking
Project PALAASH
None of the above

quiz.text: While Sberbank’s India branch has been active in New Delhi since 2010 and offers a wide range of financial services, very recently (July 2023) Russia’s largest lender Sberbank’s branch in India has received permission from the Reserve Bank of India to establish an information technology unit in _________, where it plans to employ up to 200 IT specialists.
options: Hyderabad
Chennai
Mumbai
Ahmadabad
None of the above

quiz.text: This automaker is about to use regenerative fuel cell technology to power a manned lunar rover, opening up possibilities for using the moon's water ice as an energy source. The automaker aims to deploy the rover, named Lunar Cruiser, on the moon by 2029 and hopes to secure an order by autumn 2023. The automaker in the above statements refer to -
options: BMW Motors
Volkswagen Group
General Motors
Toyota Motor
Hyundai Motors

quiz.text: With record-breaking 12th consecutive F-1 win during the _________, Red Bull surpassed the feat of McLaren who won 11 races in 1988.
options: Pacific Grand Prix
Italian Grand Prix
Bahrain Grand Prix
Hungarian Grand Prix
Dubai Grand Prix

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) 'VC Yeshwant Ghadge Sundial Memorial' unveiled as a tribute to the Indian troops who fought in the Second World War. The memorial is in the form of a live sundial and the motto of the memorial is "Omines Sub Eodem Sole" which translates to "We all live under the same sun". It is located at________.
options: Berlin, Germany
Paris, France
Stockholm, Finland
Montone, Italy
Warsaw, Poland

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) India’s  _________ and ________ beat world no. 1 Indonesian duo Fajar Alfian and Muhammad Rian Ardianto in Korea Open. This is the third Super 500 title of their career so far after Thailand Open 2019 and Yonex Sunrise India Open 2022.
options: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy, Chirag Shetty
Satwiksairaj Rankireddy, Lakshya Sen
K. Sreekant, Lakshya Sen
Satwiksairaj Rankireddy, K. Shrikant
None of the above

quiz.text: In the Yonex US Open 2023, _______ from China won men’s singles title and Supanida Katethong from ________ won women’s singles title.
options: Lin Dan, Korea
Fajar Alfian, Malaysia
Fajar Alfian, Indonesia
Li Shifeng, Thailand
Ling Diren, China

quiz.text: In the recent (July 2023) edition of Duleep Trophy held at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru, Karnataka, ________ defeated West Zone by 75 runs.
options: East zone
South Zone
North Zone
Central Zone
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) V Geza Hetenyi Memorial Super GM Chess Tournament held in _______, Hungary won by the Indian Grandmaster ________.
options: Budapest, Gukesh D
Bucharest, Gukesh D
Budapest, R Praggnanandhaa
Sarajevo, Vignesh NR
None of the above

quiz.text: For its outstanding efforts in creating marketing avenues for Self-Help Groups (SHGs) through initiatives like AVSAR scheme, Umeed Women’s Haat, and District Rural Haat, ________ recently (July 2023) awarded with the SKOCH Award in the golden category.
options: Jammu and Kashmir Rural Livelihoods Mission
Madhya Pradesh Urban Livelihoods Mission
Bihar Rural Livelihoods Mission
Uttar Pradesh Rural Livelihoods Mission
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) seven-year-old Indian-origin girl Moksha Roy won ________. She has been volunteering for a United Nations' sustainability initiative against microplastic pollution since the age of three. She has distinction of being the world’s youngest sustainability advocate.
options: United Nations Nature Prize
British Prime Minister’s Points of Light award.
United Nations Eco Hero Award
Fridays For The Future ward
Greta Thunberg Award

quiz.text: With respect to recent (July 2023) appointments seen in the news which of the following is incorrect?
options: Sat Pal Bhanoo as Managing Director of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC)
A Madhavarao as Chairman and Managing Director of Bharat Dynamics Limited (BDL)
Manoj Yadava as Director General of Railway Protection Force
Shafi Ahsan Rizvi as an Advisor of National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA)
Deepika Padukone as Brand ambassador of ICC World Cup 2023

quiz.text: Earlier appointed as the interim CEO in November 2022, the ________recently (July 2023) appointed Adrian Mardell as its Chief Executive Officer.
options: Microsoft
Alphabet
Jaguar Land Rover
Meta
Twitter

quiz.text: President of the _______ recently (July 2023) nominated ________ as the first woman to lead Navy and as the first woman in the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
options: Australia, Adm. Mandy Shaw
United States, Adm. Lisa Franchetti
Mexico, Adm. Lisa Cooper
France, Adm. Lisa Franchetti
Italy, Commodore Rosa Primavera

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement from the following statements.
options: Former Sikkim Chief Minister Pawan Kumar Chamling still holds the record of being the longest-serving CM in the country.
Pawan Kumar Chamling was the CM of the Himalayan state for 24 years and 166 days.
Earlier Jyoti Basu of West Bengal had held the record of second longest-serving chief minister of a state before being overtaken by Naveen Patnaik.
Naveen Patnaik has become the second longest-serving chief minister of a state (Odisha) in India with a tenure of 24 years and 139 days.
None of the above.

quiz.text: Following personalities have been seen in the news recently (July 2023). Identify the incorrect combination.
options: Tony Bennett- American Singer and painter
Vijay Sampla- Politician
Kevin Mitnick- Computer Scientist and Professor
Brian Taber- Former Australia wicketkeeper
All of the Above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) by removing Australia's Travis Head on day one of the fourth Ashes Test at Old Trafford, ________ became ________ pace bowler to take 600 wickets in Test cricket.
options: Patt Cummins, third
James Anderson, first
Stuart Broad, second
Shane Warne, first
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) Virat Kohli appeared in his _______ international match as India played against_______ at Queen’s Park Oval in Trinidad. He became_______ and newest member of a very exclusive club of players.
options: 500th, New Zeeland,10th
500th, West Indies,10th
500th, Australia,5th
500th, New Zeeland,8th
600th, West Indies,10th
